item.title: shell one-liner for infinite loop
item.description: This is for a quick reference (copy-pasta). While loop This is compatible with all POSIX complient shells. while true; do date; sleep 5; done For loop If you don’t need to support sh for ((;;)) { date ; sleep 5 ; }

item.title: xargs linux command
item.description: The xargs utility reads space, tab, newline and end-of-file delimited strings from the standard input and executes utility with the strings as arguments. Why xargs? Some commands like grep can accept input from stdin, but others can’t, this is place where xargs came into picture.
